name: The Mistress of Mayaheine (Rogue 29 / Paladin 5 / Fighter 6)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Mistress of Mayaheine 


Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/98/96/d6 ... 0b8a91.jpg


I have been exploring the Rogue / Paladin combination, which I find interesting as they cover each others weaknesses well, Rogue providing enormous sneak damage, evasion and skills, Paladin providing immunities and bonuses to saves.

Here I attempt to create an ITWF Dual Shortsword Dex-Based Rogue / Paladin / Fighter, fighter providing bonus feats and Epic Weapon Specialization for +6 damage / hit.

It should be really nice from low levels, being able to dual wield from lvl 1, have weapon finesse at level 2, having a base Fort save of 8, disease immunity at level 3 and fear immunity at level 4. Improved Knockdown & Blind Fight level 9, ITWF lvl 12, and Crippling Strike Level 14. 

Ending sneak attack is 15d6 which is more than ample. if you want more, you could drop the epic skill foci for improved sneak attack for 17d6

Taunt 41(53) is in the build to assist the character to hit things, as with Base 40 AB it good, taunt helps with up to effective +6 AB when needed.

I also put Power Attack, Divine Might and EWS in the build, so damage can be boosted with +11 physical and +2-8 divine damage / hit to help deal with physical damage resistant critical/sneak immune opponents.

I've also found a way to avoid exp penalties completely, which is great. This does create a large mid epic section where Discipline does not have a skill dump. 


Image source:  https://data.whicdn.com/images/254265481/original.jpg



Discipline is largely there to avoid getting Improved Disarmed (ID) and provide Knockdown resistance. Improved Disarm is not a major feature of many modules, however some modules it is an issue that will have to be carefully managed. 

Will save 17(21) will be another weakness, its partly protected with fear immunity (allowing you to ignore those fear circles around undead & dragons & others) and 20 points in spellcraft but best to drink a few clarity potions, use UMD for Prot v Evil scrolls / Lesser Mind Blank etc

The other usual weaknesses, no DC arcane spells like Bigby's/IGMS, dev critters/implosion, petrify users, powerful ranged opponents are a pain for everyone, I believe careful strategy and boosting the fort save helps.

I put the HP to 360 so the character can tank combined with epic dodge, improved evasion and a great fort and reflex save, add a shield as well, equip a few constitution boosting items and buffs.

Human is there for the extra pre-epic feat and extra skill points, medium size to wield two shortswords (dual sword builds are cool). 

Halfling might have higher AB with two daggers, I chose to not pursue this however

posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
I've always wanted to play a Paladin/Rogue. I envisage this character as an intuitive seeker, driven and granted special powers by some unseen divinity.

As you pointed it has the classic rogue weakness of low Will saves. Is it worth replacing crippling strike with slippery mind and defensive roll with Epic Will?

Or will the Potions and UMD be sufficient, as being dispelled could be a concern.

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
I would be hard pressed to replace crippling strike in this build! Crippling strike is awesome..Additionally, one needs defensive roll for epic dodge...

The only thing I plan on doing when playing this build (and I think it might be my next one) is to drop that con down and boost int and or strength...
Perhaps make it an elf and drop divine might.

Drop crippling strike...I'd say no way.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hail SnorriHT and Gkorjax!
Thanks for your kind replies
I did think of you Gkorjax when I wrote this build draft, I know you like these stealthy builds

I think all builds can be modified to suit the environment they play in as Gkorjax is already thinking
I write a general build description to describe what might suit many players, they can then modify as needed
I did very much wish to have Str and Int to 14 actually, it adds 43 extra skill points and extra carry capacity. Dropping starting Con to 12 is probably the best way to do it.
Elf is a very attractive variant. There will be 40% exp penalties pretty early on which may deter many but for some that is no problem.

Slippery Mind can be fit into the build, perhaps by dropping ESF: Discipline and putting ESF: Taunt later (so you can take slippery mind earlier early epic), as Crippling Strike is quite good as Gkorjax wrote, -2 Str per sneak attack you eliminate the offensive capabilities rapidly, destroy their discipline score allowing you to knockdown them down more easily and slow them down to a crawl, its excellent against sneak vulnerable opponents who heal themselves a lot. 
Epic Will can be fit in too, my suggestion is to swap this with toughness.

posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
Crippling strike is awesome. But I always think worst case, where a Boss is immune to sneak attacks and has true seeing.

Also if a character is flat footed (i.e. paralysed) or feared, then I don't believe defensive roll can be used. 

Being my own Devil's advocate though, playing a Rogue is all about playing smart and that includes knowledge of and avoiding high risk enemies.

*edit* I wrote this before seeing your previous replay...I'm a slow typer ;-)

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
SnorriHT wrote:
Mar 15, 2020
Crippling strike is awesome. But I always think worst case, where a Boss is immune to sneak attacks and has true seeing.
That is an awful situation to be in! Add a fear aura and that is a vanilla rogue's worst nightmare. 
Sounds like a dragon to me!

Oh yes I didn't answer your question about the Will save -> UMD and Clarity potions are often enough to protect the low Will save if you are smart
Gkorjax has taught me a lot actually how to play low Will save builds

The exception being against mixed mobs of warriors and casters who can dispel these
You probably can manage this by taking them on one at a time if you are solo, or with traps, or in a party with a cleric or mage casting Protection vs Evil/Clarity/Lesser Mind Blank/Mind Blank on you which will have dispel resistance (or 'undispellability' if their caster levels are 24+)

Defensive roll I agree with you is not a great feat, it is only there because it is required for Epic Dodge. I would drop it in an instant, as you have been thinking, if it wasn't a requirement for Epic Dodge.
